bibl.title: B. Norman v. J.F. Warren. Type of document
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court of the Territory of Washington Spokane County

body.p: Territory of Washington County of Spokane To Hon. George Turner, Judge of 4th Judicial District of Washington Territory.

Your petitioner the undersigned B. Norman respectfully represents to your honor that he is restrained of his liberty by one J.F. Warren Chief of Police of the city of Spokane Falls in said County and Territory, in said city.
The cause on pretense of said restraint is a commitment issued by J.R. Snyder on the 24 day of February 1888 directed to said woman as said Chief of Police.

Your petitioner represents that the said restraint is illegal, in this to wit that said commitment is issued upon a judgement in favor of the City of Spokane Falls, accident upon the following complaint, to wit.
Territory of Washington County of Spokane City of Spokane Falls
Justice Court before J.R. Snyder Justice of th Peace and Police Justice of the Peace of Spokane Falls.
The City of Spokane Falls. vs. B. Norman

Sworn and examined on aoth charged B. Norman with the crime of wilfully violation sec. 5 of an ordinance establish fire limits in the city of Spokane Falls committed on to wit the 24 day of February 1888 within the corporate limits of the City of Spokane Falls within said County and Territory. Said B. Norman did then and there being unlawfully move a certain wooden building now within the said fire limits to another lot within said fire limits to writ a certain lot on street between Post and Mill street on the north side of said street all of which is contrary to the ordinance made and provided and against the peace and dignity of the City of Spokane Falls
"J.F. Warren" Subscribed and sworn in before on this 24 day of February 1888. J.F. Snyder Police Justice of the Peace
The said ordinance in said mentioned is as follows, towit
Without jurisdiction to render said Judgement or issue said comitment and that your petitioner is restrained of his said liberty by virtue of no other authority or pretense

Wherefore your petitioner prays that a writ of Habeas Corpus may issue said Warren to said Sonnon before you to use to inquire into said matter and that he may be discharged of each complaint B. Norman

Territory of Washington } SS County of Spokane B. Norman being first duly sworn on his oath states that he is the petitioner above agreement That he has heard read the foregoing petition, knowing the contents thereof and believes the same to be true B. Norman

Subscribed and sworn to before me this 24 day of February 1888.
Notary Public
